alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 22 at 3:58AM AKDT until March 22 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FROM TURNAGAIN PASS TO THE STERLING HIGHWAY JUNCTION... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected with visibilities down to a quarter mile or less in blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...The Seward Highway corridor from Turnagain Pass to the Sterling Highway Junction. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to a quarter of a mile or less. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and afternoon commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are mostly likely between Turnagain Pass and the Sterling Highway junction. Rain may mix with snow during the afternoon hours today at sea level, but the rain/snow line is expected to remain between sea level and 200 ft in elevation through the duration of the event. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches with heaviest accumulations near Turnagain Pass.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
